title: Adobong Pusit (Squid Adobo) Recipe
description: This adobong pusit recipe is made with small squid simmered with onion, garlic, and tomato in vinegar and soy sauce for a quick, easy Pinoy fish dish.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Adobong Pusit (Squid Adobo) 4.1 (10) 9 Reviews 8 Photos Adobong pusit is a Filipino squid recipe that tastes best if you use fresh, smaller squid. Squid is simmered with onion, garlic, tomato, vinegar, and soy sauce for a tasty meal. Submitted by lola Updated on November 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 5 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 2 ¼ pounds squid, cleaned ½ cup white vinegar ½ cup water salt and ground black pepper to taste 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 small onion, minced 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 tomato, chopped 1 tablespoon soy sauce Directions Combine squid, vinegar, and water in a small pot over medium heat; season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in tomato and soy sauce. Pour squid mixture into tomato mixture and bring to a simmer; cook for 20 minutes. I Made It Print 35 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 198 Calories 7g Fat 3g Carbs 28g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 198 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 1g 4% Sodium 215mg 9% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 1g Protein 28g 57% Vitamin C 5mg 6% Calcium 86mg 7% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 103mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Adobong Pusit (Squid Adobo) 01 of 08 Photo by  Bret Michael Urmeneta 02 of 08 Photo by  Maybe An Angel 11/18/2021 03 of 08 Photo by  Bret Michael Urmeneta 01/23/2019 04 of 08 Photo by  jess 01/22/2019 05 of 08 Photo by  Maria Luisa De Real - Ocampo 04/12/2018 06 of 08 Photo by  Kuntrygyrl1 05/26/2017 This was delicious. I love squid and adobo was recommended to me. I did no substitutions but added an additional 1/2tbsp of soy sauce, only 1 small tomato, 4 cloves of garlic, and 3/4 of the liquid from boiling it first. I added in parts as it cooked to prevent it being soupy. It was a good balance of sweet and salty and I will definitely make this again. 07 of 08 Photo by  Emmalyn Domingo-Padua 05/31/2016 08 of 08 Photo by  ievencookedthis 06/28/2011 1 You’ll Also Love Crab Omelet 6 Ratings Bringhe 9 Ratings Salmon Sarciado 30 Ratings Pinakbet 26 Ratings Pinoy Chicken Adobo 38 Ratings Guinataan Chicken Adobo 36 Ratings Chicken Arroz Caldo (Chicken Rice Porridge) 93 Ratings Bopis Recipe 4 Ratings Chicken with Chicharo (Snow Peas) 5 Ratings Pochero 3 Ratings Famous Chicken Adobo 364 Ratings Chicken Tinola 101 Ratings Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk) 48 Ratings Ginataang Alimasag (Crabs in Coconut Milk) 3 Ratings Sinigang na Bangus (Filipino Milkfish in Tamarind Broth) 1 Rating Filipino Spaghetti 17 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: lola
instructions: Combine squid, vinegar, and water in a small pot over medium heat; season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.;Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in tomato and soy sauce.;Pour squid mixture into tomato mixture and bring to a simmer; cook for 20 minutes.
